intro: Asemeia subaphylla, commonly known as the narrow-leaf asemeia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, aromatic leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Asemeia subaphylla typically grows in rocky soils and arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
